description: You found a bush full of ripe berries and got ***{value}*** berries!
You searched through bushes and found ***{value}*** berries!
A Struthiomimus came up to you while searching for berries and dropped you ***{value}*** of them!
While foraging, you tripped over a fallen log… but underneath it was a stash of ***{value}*** berries!
You wandered into a shaded patch and found ***{value}*** berries!
You spotted a glint of red in the grass—turns out to be ***{value}*** juicy berries!
You returned to a spot you marked earlier and found ***{value}*** berries waiting.
You shook a bush with your crest and ***{value}*** berries rained down!
A baby Parasaurolophus pointed you toward a thicket; ***{value}*** berries inside!
While bathing in a stream, berries floated by—snagged ***{value}*** of them!
You followed a trail of berry juice and discovered ***{value}*** ripe ones!
You chased off a Styracosaurus that was hoarding ***{value}*** berries—yours now!
You dug under a fern and unearthed a buried stash—***{value}*** berries!
A pile of dung had seeds growing around it—strange, but ***{value}*** berries gathered!
A thunderstorm rolled in, but you braved it for ***{value}*** berries!
You found a hidden grove behind a waterfall—***{value}*** berries!
You knocked down a tree branch and got ***{value}*** berries off it.
You found a trail of smashed berries—only ***{value}*** salvageable.
A juvenile stole your berries, but you caught them! Got ***{value}*** back.
You wandered near the herd's edge and found ***{value}*** untouched berries!
You bumped a branch and ***{value}*** berries dropped right onto your head!
You tripped, rolled down a hill, and landed in a bush full of berries—***{value}*** berries for style!
You danced in the rain and stumbled on ***{value}*** berries, lucky day!
You foraged under moonlight, mysterious: but ***{value}*** berries found!
You returned to a favorite spot and scored ***{value}*** berries again!
You found a bush so heavy with berries it nearly collapsed—***{value}*** berries!
You kicked over a log and found ***{value}*** berries nestled underneath.
You followed a bird call and it led to ***{value}*** berries!
A friend pointed out a dense shrub—***{value}*** berries were waiting.
You stepped into a mossy patch and unearthed ***{value}*** berries.
You followed an insect trail and uncovered ***{value}*** sweet berries.
You circled a Big Quill Lake and found ***{value}*** berries near a fallen tree.
You splashed into the pond of Hunter's Thicket and emerged with ***{value}*** berries!
A bird's nest led you to a forgotten patch with ***{value}*** berries.
You pushed through ferns and collected ***{value}*** berries from a shaded bush.
You asked a Deinonychus if it had seen berries... it screamed and ran off. You followed and found ***{value}*** berries behind it!
A snooty Psittacosaurus challenged you to a berry-finding contest. You won with ***{value}*** berries and it stormed off muttering.
A Kentrosaurus tail-whipped a tree in frustration. ***{value}*** berries fell and you casually gathered them.
You and an Eotriceratops played "who can bonk the bush hardest"—you won ***{value}*** berries and a sore crest.
A Ceratosaurus roared at you. You screamed back louder. It left. You got ***{value}*** berries and no regrets.
A sleepy Anodontosaurus crushed a berry patch in its nap. You scooped ***{value}*** mashed ones from under its tail.
A Segnosaurus was too busy posing to notice the ***{value}*** berries behind it. You graciously helped yourself.
You walked in on two Pachycephalosaurs bonking at a tree. Berries rained down from the impact—***{value}*** berries gathered!
A group of Utahraptors were too busy arguing over a bone. You waltzed in and took the ***{value}***-berry jackpot next to them.
A snoozing Deinocheirus was humming in its sleep. You collected ***{value}*** berries around it without waking the gentle giant.
A bickering pair of Apatosaurus were arguing over who found the bush first. You just took the ***{value}*** berries and left.
A well-kept Bonapartenykus gifted you ***{value}*** berries after you complimented their tail.
A Citipati offered you ***{value}*** berries for not honking near its nap spot. Fair trade.
After foraging, you return to find a sneaky Rhamphorhynchus stole ***{value}*** berries from your pile!
You found a berry patch picked clean... ***{value}*** berries this time.
You wandered too far and found nothing but thorns—***{value}*** berries.
A dry patch gave you nothing but dust—***{value}*** berries today.
A juvenile Therizinosaurus stole your berries, and its father was right behind him: lost ***{value}*** berries!
A Deinosuchus roared nearby—you ran and dropped ***{value}*** berries!
You searched high and low… and found ***{value}*** berries. Just leaves. Crunchy, disappointing leaves.
A Struthiomimus ran past and stole ***{value}*** berries right out of your mouth.
A Dryosaurus screamed at you for looking at its bush. You left with ***{value}*** berries and wounded pride.
You reached for a shiny berry... but it was a rock: ***{value}*** berries!
You found a promising bush—but it was full of thorny twigs and lies: ***{value}*** berries!
You watched a Therizinosaurus eat the last berry. It made deep eye contact while chewing.
A strong gust of wind blew all the berries off the bush. Into a river. ***{value}*** berries!
You found berries! Then a pack of Utahraptors hissed and chased you off before you could take a single one.
You found a great bush… but so did ten angry Eotriceratops. You retreated with ***{value}***.
You got stuck in a bush trying to reach a single berry. You didn't even get the berry.
An Argentinosaurus offered to "share" the bush. You blinked. It took everything.
A Stegosaurus mistook a berry pile for a foot scrub pad. You cried inside.
You stepped on a stick, scared yourself, and ran headfirst into a log. Berries? None.
A Compsognathus offered to "watch your stash." You came back to ***{value}*** stolen berries and zero Compsognathus.
You stood in front of a bush for ten minutes, unsure if it was real. It wasn't.
You chased a bouncing berry downhill and lost both the berry and your dignity.
You followed your nose into a bush… and walked into a thorny bush. Ouch.
You stared lovingly at a bush. So did an Apatosaurus. You let it win.
An Anodontosaurus screamed "MY BUSH" and shoved you down a hill. No berries, just ego damage.
You mistook an Amanita for berries. Your tongue is still tingling.
A Spinosaurus hissed from the water. You dropped ***{value}*** berries out of instinct.
You walked into Sharptooth Marsh for some rare berries. You found leeches.
You sat to enjoy your harvest, only for a Miragaia to accidentally tail-flick your berries into the river.
You finally found berries… just as it started raining, and everything turned to mush: ***{value}*** berries!
You fell asleep next to a bush and woke up to find it stripped clean by your friend.
You spent an hour collecting berries. An Amargasaurus accidentally stepped on them.
You slipped and sat on your own new-found stash. You are now covered in berry jam and shame.
You bent down to pick berries and sneezed so hard, you flung every last one into the river behind you.
You grabbed what you thought was a berry… and got a plump red spider instead.
A Deinosuchus sunbathing nearby made you rethink the entire berry plan. You left hungry.
You knocked a full branch down—but a Psittacosaurus yelled "FINDERS KEEPERS!" and ran off with it.
You found a berry-filled patch, but it was guarded by a mother Stegosaurus. Not today.
You tried climbing a hill to a berry bush. You slipped. Three times. Still no berries.
You slipped into a shallow pond and watched helplessly as your new-found berries floated away.
A juvenile Parasaurolophus offered you a "trade." You gave some new berries. It gave you a rock—***{value}*** berries!
A Latenivenatrix prankster replaced all your new-found berries with round pebbles. You bit one. It hurt.
You spotted a bush… so did a Sauropod's foot. You didn't even try to argue.
You found purple "berries" and realized too late they were tiny dino droppings.
You picked an entire branch full of fruit—then noticed hornets crawling out.
You found blue berries! Then a Lambeosaurus told you those were poisonous—***{value}*** berries!
